Key Match Events: Randal Kolo Muani's shot forced an own goal by Jan Vertonghen five minutes from time
Post-Match Reflections: France coach Didier Deschamps: 'We're enjoying this, we pushed hard, we had a lot of attempts but we were missing the target'
Randal Kolo Muani: 'I got lucky [on the goal]. The coach had told me to bring my energy... to bring danger with my speed. I tried to bring some freshness to the game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: France still have yet to score from open play at the tournament, recording two own goals and a Kylian Mbappé penalty across their four games so far
Others: France will now meet the winner of Monday's match between Portugal and Slovenia in the quarterfinals in Hamburg on Friday
Belgium clearly had a plan to take any speed out of the game, playing at less than walking pace at times
The best chance of the first half came for France after 34 minutes when Jules Koundé whipped in a curling cross that Marcus Thuram headed wide
Aurélien Tchouaméni forced Koen Casteels into his first save of the day soon after the break
Romelu Lukaku and Kevin De Bruyne then brought good saves from Mike Maignan
France's poor finishing continued with William Saliba and Mbappé both blazing over before Kolo Muani struck late on to win it
